newsitem.title: USA: Sears January U.S. same store sales rise.
newsitem.headline: Sears January U.S. same store sales rise.

text.p: Sears, Roebuck and Co said Thursday its domestic same store revenues rose 5.8 percent for the four weeks ended February 1.
This compared with a 0.6 percent increase in the same period a year ago.
Total domestic sales for the four-week period were $1.69 billion, up 12.1 percent from $1.50 billion for the four weeks ended February 3.

"Sears' strong sales momentum continued in January," Arthur Martinez, chairman, said in a statement. "Our full-line stores again generated double-digit increases in softlines, including women's ready to wear, children's apparel, shoes, accessories, cosmetics and fine jewelry."
In hardlines, he said sales were led by double-digit increases in appliances, including microwaves, ranges, dishwashers, washing machines and dryers.
"Solid comparble store increases also were generated by our off-the-mall hardware, dealer and tire stores," Martinez said.
For the four-weeks ending February 1, Sears reported total revenues of $2.44 billion, up 11.8 percent from the $2.18 billion reported in the prior year.
For the 52 weeks ended February 1, Sears reported total revenues of $37.86 billion, 9.1 percent above the $34.69 billion in the prior-year period.
